chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bennie D Fleming Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bennie D Fleming Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Concur to 22CF2036, 22CF1469, 22CF442, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324 and 14CM1953. To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bennie D Fleming Jr

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:43 PM Defendant Bennie D Fleming Jr in court with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days in Dane County Jail, to be served in the WSP 
-cc to 22CF442, 22CF1469, 22CF2036, 11CF271, 11CF273, 11CF324, and 14CM1953

-Days credit for time served: 120 days credit 
-Days credit to jail: 120 days credit

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge to be paid through DOC

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Shaun W. O'Connell appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Plea/Sentencing scheduled.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

02:56 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Timothy Robert Verhoff and intern Kevin M appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Madison Police Officer S. Z., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by intern Kevin M. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty O'Connell. Witness excused. Madison Police Officer J. H., duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by intern Kevin M. Cross Exam by Atty O'Connell. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty O'Connell. Rebuttal argument by intern Kevin M. Defn responds. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 2.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lot 51 Auto Sales. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jessica M. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:15 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
